Sentencas: Surfaces and interfaces determine the performance and long-term durability of solid-oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Surface segregation and poisoning in materials for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: In most cases, the surface chemical composition of the materials used in these electrochemical energy conversion devices shows significant deviations from the bulk chemistry.
Titulo: Surface segregation and poisoning in materials for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: This might be as a result of surface cation segregation processes, as well as long-term surface poisoning due to external impurities.
Titulo: Surface segregation and poisoning in materials for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: Both processes have implications for the electrochemical performance of the devices, leading to the degradation of the cell components.
Titulo: Surface segregation and poisoning in materials for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: In order to suppress this degradation, an effort to lower the operation temperature to 500-800 degrees C has been made.
Titulo: Surface segregation and poisoning in materials for low-temperature SOFCs

Sentencas: This article provides an overview of present research progress related to surface segregation and poisoning for low-temperature SOFCs.
Titulo: Surface segregation and poisoning in materials for low-temperature SOFCs
